answerText: epithelial-mesenchymal transition [or EMT][10] Specifically, the EMT for cancer cells leads to this phenomenon, the spread of a tumor from one area of the body to another.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | Dorman-Carleton-LASA B | 10 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this transition by which cells that are firmly attached to an extracellular matrix or membrane are extruded. Malignant tumors must have undergone this transition.
